name: Shoreline società cooperativa
membership:
WWF (www.wwf.it)
International Union for Conservation of Nature - IUCN (www.iucn.org)
goal:
Shoreline cooperative was established in 1988 by a group of young marine biologists involved
in environmental conservation. Its main activity is providing services to marine protected areas.
In 1996 its own office and laboratory were opened at AREA Science Park (Trieste, Italy).
Shoreline is quality certified (UNI EN ISO 9001:2000), is recognised as a High Qualified Laboratory from the Ministry of Education, University and Research and is authorized for running research activity in the field of fisheries and aquaculture by the Ministry for Agriculture.
The staff is composed mainly of biologists, but also geologists, sociologists, architects, lawyers.
interests: Environment, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries
euInitiatives:
TAIEF Project. The Environmental Technical Assistance and Information Exchange Facility, TAIEF, offers short-term peer-to-peer assistance to support environmental policy development and implementation in Asia, Africa, and Latin America. The following is an indicative list of the countries covered: Asia: China, India, Indonesia, Kazakhstan, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam;
Africa: Kenya, Nigeria and South Africa;
Latin America: Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Peru, Bolivia, Guatemala, Mexico.
TAIEF offers rapid mobilisation of experts from EU member state administrations to contribute to workshops or seminars, or to provide short-term targeted assistance on environmental challenges.
customers: Istituto Nazionale di Oceanografia e Geofisica Sperimentale
